is-visible StoryBody__sponsored-logo-lazy-load"><div class="StoryBody__sponsored-logo-wrapper"></div></div><article class="Body"><div class="Body__content"><div class="Mobiledoc"><p>Reacting to a Fox News interview with Attorney General William Barr that included Barr essentially threatening Democrats who criticize him and justifying the president calling the Mueller probe a “witch hunt,” Fox News anchor <a class="LinkWrapper LinkWrapper--external" href="https://contemptor.com/2019/05/01/chris-wallace-fires-back-at-foxs-opinion-people-who-are-pushing-a-political-agenda-on-mueller/">Chris Wallace</a> said Friday that Trump now has a new fixer.</p><p>In the interview that was aired Friday, <a class="LinkWrapper LinkWrapper--external" href="https://twitter.com/atrupar/status/1129382859125481472">Barr told Fox News anchor Bill Hemmer</a> that House Democrats who have accused him of contempt of Congress are discrediting him because they’re likely “concerned about the outcome of a review of what happened during the election.” Furthermore, the attorney general said he wants to see if FBI officials <a class="LinkWrapper LinkWrapper--external" href="https://twitter.com/mattzap/status/1129345491228086272">“put their thumb on the scale” </a>during the Russia investigation, especially during the origins of it.</p><p>During Friday’s broadcast of <em>America’s Newsroom</em>, Wallace praised Hemmer’s interview of the attorney general, claiming he did a “hell of a job and squeezed the sponge dry getting everything that Bill Barr was prepared to say.”</p><section class="Fancylinks"><ul class="Fancylinks__list"><li class="FancylinksItem"><div class="FancylinksItem__container"><div class="FancylinksItem__left"><a class="TrackingLink FancylinksItem__link" href="/fox-news-chris-wallace-trashes-barrs-mueller-report-presser-he-acted-as-trumps-defense-lawyer"><div class="FancylinksItem__top-left"><div class="FancylinksItem__rubric">DON’T HOLD BACK</div><h3 class="FancylinksItem__headline">Fox News’ Chris Wallace Trashes Barr’s Mueller Presser</h3></div></a><div class="FancylinksItem__bottom-left"><div class="FancylinksItem__author"><div class="Byline Byline--horizontal Byline--small"><a class="TrackingLink Byline__author" href="/author/justin-baragona"><h4 class="Byline__author-name">Justin Baragona</h4></a></div></div></div></div><div class="FancylinksItem__right"><a class="TrackingLink FancylinksItem__link" href="/fox-news-chris-wallace-trashes-barrs-mueller-report-presser-he-acted-as-trumps-defense-lawyer"><figure class="Image FancylinksItem__image"><div class="Image__wrapper"><img style="height: 138.375px; width: 246px; background: #000"><div class="Image__title-and-caption" style=""></div></div></figure></a></div></div></li></ul></section><p>The Fox News anchor went on to note that we had heard Trump complain openly for the past two years that he didn’t have an attorney general who would look out for him and protect his interests.</p><p>“He clearly has that now with Bill Barr,” Wallace asserted. “Not saying that Barr isn’t right in everything he says. But he clearly is protecting this president and advocating his point of view on a lot of these issues.”</p><p>He added: “I suspect that as President Trump, who probably has watched some of this interview himself, is saying: ‘Finally no Jeff Sessions, Bill Barr instead.’”</p><p>This isn’t the first time that Wallace has dinged Barr for acting on the president’s personal behalf. Following Barr’s presser ahead of the release of the redacted Mueller report, <a class="TrackingLink LinkWrapper" href="https://www.thedailybeast.com/fox-news-chris-wallace-trashes-barrs-mueller-report-presser-he-acted-as-trumps-defense-lawyer">the <em>Fox News Sunday</em> host said</a> that the attorney general was acting like Trump’s defense lawyer. He <a class="LinkWrapper LinkWrapper--external" href="https://contemptor.com/2019/04/19/foxs-chris-wallace-barrs-decision-to-not-charge-trump-troubling-and-politically-charged/">later called</a> Barr’s decision not to charge the president with obstruction of justice was “troubling” and “politically-charged” based on Mueller’s conclusions.</p></div></div></article><div class="StoryFooter StoryFooter--with-tips"><div class="StoryFooter__tips"><div class="TipsCTA"><ul class="TipsCTA__authors"><li class="TipsAuthor"><a class="TipsAuthor__name" href="https://www.thedailybeast.com/author/justin-baragona">Justin Baragona</a><div class="TipsAuthor__links"><a class="TrackingLink TipsAuthor__twitter" href="https://twitter.com/justinbaragona"><svg class="TipsAuthor__twitter-icon"><use xlink:href="#twitter"></use></svg><span class="TipsAuthor__twitter-name">@<!-- -->justinbaragona</span></a></div></li></ul><p class="TipsCTA__text">Got a tip?
